# Data cleaning
```{r data_import, include=FALSE}
data_2020 = read.csv("data/2020-States.csv")
data_2021 = read.csv("data/2021-States.csv")
data_2022 = read.csv("data/2022-States.csv")
data_2023 = read.csv("data/2023-States.csv")
crude_oil_data = read.csv("data/crude-oil-price.csv")
```

```{r data_merge}

#Merge all flights datasets together
data_2020 = select(data_2020, Entity, Day, Flights)
data_2021 = select(data_2021, Entity, Day, Flights)
data_2022 = select(data_2022, Entity, Day, Flights)
data_2023 = select(data_2023, Entity, Day, Flights)
data_all_years = rbind(data_2020, data_2021, data_2022, data_2023)

#Select only data where country == switzerland
data_all_years = data_all_years[data_all_years$Entity == 'Switzerland',]
data_all_years$year_month = format(as.Date(data_all_years$Day), "%Y-%m")



#Cleaning crude-oil data set
crude_oil_data$year_month = format(as.Date(crude_oil_data$date), "%Y-%m") #Transforming date column
crude_oil_data = crude_oil_data[crude_oil_data$year_month >= '2020-01',] #Keeping only recent records

#Find how to merge dataset with oil prices 
flight_and_oil = left_join(data_all_years, crude_oil_data, "year_month")


```
